data.title: About – SP Seva Sansthan Foundation
data.text:
About us

Who we are

Work As a Catalyst In Bringing Sustainable Change In The Live Of Underprivileged Children, Youth And Women, With A Life Cycle Approach Of Development.

SP Seva Sansthan Foundation was founded in the year 2014 aiming to achieve great facts in the non-profit segment. We Registered our organization In 2021. The primary focus is to alleviate on the problems of the poor and their struggle to obtain a life of justice and dignity focusing on Child Welfare, Women Empowerment & Rural Development. An in depth understanding of issues in the area and consistent support from community members, have led the organization to undertake and implement various need based interventions on education, health, environment, and skill development at grass root level.

Our approach

Our Mission

Empowering Underprivileged Individuals, Across All Fields.

As an “agent of change,” our mission is to assist the most vulnerable members of society, including the impoverished, children, women, the elderly, and the sick, in accessing and realizing their rights as enshrined in the constitution of India. The fundamental concept behind SP Seva Sansthan Foundation is to provide aid to those in dire need. We strive to empower individuals to reach their full potential and lead happy, healthy lives with dignity. By fostering a sustainable society for future generations, we aim to instill futuristic ideals into our practices. Since our inception, we have remained steadfast in our commitment to complete dedication and transparency towards our objectives.

Our Vision

Providing Swift Support for Every Child, Youth and others in Need.

Work As a Catalyst In Bringing Sustainable Change In The Live Of Underprivileged Children, Youth And Women, With A Life Cycle Approach Of Development.

We do not think that What the Country Has Given Us,

We Think That What the Country Get From Us.

Founder

His Message

Our long-term efforts at SPSS Foundation towards equitable development, our commitment to include disadvantaged underprivileged, children, and women in mainstream development continue to bring changes in their lives. When we review our work, we feel inspired to realize that we have made a small contribution to achieving sustainable goals. Recognizing the reciprocal relationship between the efforts of grassroots voluntary organizations and globally set development goals reveals the critical role these organizations play and establishes the fact that both small and large efforts towards development are required to change lives.

Our Core Team

Empowering Communities, One Step at a Time

Jyoti Vaishnav

DIrector

Usha Suthar

Member – Jodhpur

Vishesh Chandra
